Tucson was in pain but he knew he had to keep on his toes if he was to get =
out of this battle in one piece.  He had to figure out a way to get Magmatr=
on to literally take a few hits but through indirect means.  He thinks to h=
imself as to how to go about doing so.  But then, it comes to him.  The old=
 dragon must have had many friends among the Natural world, including the c=
avern where they were now.  

" When all else fails, turn to those who are =
your most trusted followers.  No matter their size, what lives among you in=
 Nature, can prove to be your greatest  comrades.  I get it now.   I know w=
hat I must do."

Straightshot stops the music, as she watches her brother l=
ift his head and begin to emit a soft rumble from his throat.  Yet the pitc=
h of the sound is too high for normal ears, it is well received by throngs =
of cave dwelling bats that swarm out in clouds of activity.  He hoped that =
they would be enough to throw Magmatron for a loop.

Quickstride tries desp=
erately to fend off the remaining Sharkitcons while Rattrap lends him a han=
d in doing so.  It's at this time when bats cover the air around them.

" W=
hoah!  Where'd these things come from?!"

They learn to sidestep the bats y=
et the tiny creatures continue to swarm!

m has helped immensly.

 The heavier you are,

AGMATRON

ht

of their own anger and power! As much
> as TUSCON was relying on agility an=
d training, it was obvious to
> onlookers that MAGMATRON was also well trai=
ned.

chimeric dragon-like

sly at TUSCON,
